BITD.Name: Name
BITD.ChosenAbilityDetail:
Your Chosen gains a Chosen ability when:
  • You first select your Chosen.
  • You complete a campaign.
  • You complete four missions of your Chosen‚Äôs favor type.
BITD.BrokenAbilityDetail:
Your Broken gains an additional Broken ability when:
  • You first select your Broken.
  • A time clock is filled (see Commander sheet).
BITD.SquadsLabel: The rookies and soldiers. Click the plus beside each squad to populate it with fresh rookies
BITD.CreateRookies: Fill out this squad with five newly created Rookies
BITD.SpecialistsLabel: The experienced and powerful Legionnaires who head each mission
BITD.DutiesLabel: During the game, do the following:
BITD.PressureLabel: A measure of how surrounded you are by undead
BITD.PressureDetail: When you advance, roll pressure minus Horses uses spent, and add time below. (1-3: One. 4/5: Two. 6: Three. CRIT: Five) Then reset pressure to 0. Add pressure when time passes (after campaign actions), or when there is a pressure penalty for a failed mission.
BITD.PressureHelp: Before you roll, consult the Quartermaster. For each expenditure of Horses the Quartermaster makes, use the Modifier dropdown to reduce Pressure by one. Add Time based on the result.
BITD.TimeLabel: How long you have to get to Skydagger and how undead strength grows
BITD.TimeDetail: Add 1 tick when time passes, or when you advance and roll pressure, and when missions have a time penalty. Reduce the clocks when mission rewards include time. If you do not complete the missions at Skydagger Keep before the last clock is filled, you lose the game.
BITD.IntelLabel: A measure of how much you know about undead movements and the war
BITD.IntelDetail: Spend 1 intel to add +1d to any engagement roll, or to access a special mission in a location in addition to your mission priorities. Gain intel from Recon mission rewards. Before you pick primary and secondary missions, ask intel questions based on how much intel you hold (see below).
BITD.IntelQuestions0:
You may ask one of the following questions:
  • What‚Äôs the highest threat we can expect?
  • How much travel should we expect?
  • What would be a useful item to bring?
  • What are 2 approaches we could use here?
  • How‚Äôs our Chosen feel about the missions?
  • Which squads distrust or don‚Äôt respect the leadership?
BITD.IntelQuestions1:
You may also ask one of the following questions:
  • What‚Äôs useful to bring on this mission?
  • Who‚Äôs invested in this mission?
  • What‚Äôs a challenge on this mission?
  • Whose troops might we expect to encounter on these missions?
  • What resources or benefits might we find at a specific location ahead?
  • What might be a weakness of an Elite we have encountered?
  • What might be a craving or instinct of an Elite we have encountered?
BITD.IntelQuestions2:
You may also ask one of the following questions:
  • Which Infamous or Lieutenant might we face on this mission?
  • What‚Äôs the main weakness of the undead‚Äôs position on this mission?
  • Is this related to a previous mission? How?
  • Which way are the Broken moving?
  • What is a weakness of an Infamous we‚Äôve seen previously?
  • What challenges or problems are inherent in a specific location ahead?
BITD.IntelQuestions3:
You may also ask one of the following questions:
  • What is the weakness of a Lieutenant we‚Äôve encountered previously?
  • What is a craving or instinct of a Lieutenant we‚Äôve encountered previously?
  • What is a specific Broken researching?
  • What special missions have we heard of at a location ahead?
  • What news of the Cinder King?
BITD.EngagementLabel: The Marshal assembles and rolls dice for engagements.
BITD.EngagementDetail:
Engagement rolls determine unit disposition at the start of a primary mission and the outcome of secondary missions. As the one sending troops into battle, it‚Äôs the Marshal‚Äôs duty to assemble the dice and make the engagement rolls.
Before every mission, assemble the engagement roll by asking the following:
BITD.EngagementHelp: Assemble the Engagement roll based on the questions listed on the Marshal sheet, as appropriate to the type of mission.
BITD.EngagementGeneral:
All Missions:
  • Legion Loyalty Are all on the mission oathsworn to the Legion? Take +1d.
  • Intel Did the Commander spend 1 intel to give you foresight and info? Take +1d.
  • Veteran Is everyone on the mission a Specialist or Soldier? Take +1d.
  • Leadership Does any Legionnaire distrust the leadership or not fear them enough to obey orders on the battlefield? Take -1d.
  • Parameters Are required Specialists or equipment not on the mission? Take -1d.
BITD.EngagementAssault:
Assault Missions:
  • Weapons Did the Quartermaster equip the soldiers with Black Shot? Take +1d.
  • Wounds Is any Legionnaire starting the mission wounded? Take -1d.
BITD.EngagementRecon:
Recon Missions:
  • Speed Did the Quartermaster spend Horses to equip the mission? Take +1d.
  • Stealth Is any Legionnaire starting with heavy load? Take -1d.
BITD.EngagementReligious:
Religious Missions:
  • Arcane Did the Quartermaster send Religious Supplies to ward and protect the Legionnaires? Take +1d.
  • Corruption Is any Legionnaire starting with blight? Take -1d.
BITD.EngagementSupply:
Supply Missions:
  • Supplies Did the Quartermaster spend Food to equip the mission? Take +1d.
  • Enemies Is the current pressure higher than 2? Take -1d.
BITD.MoraleLabel: Represents the esprit-de-corps, emotional fatigue, and the hopes and dreams of the troops
BITD.MoraleDetail:
Gain morale from: Successful mission rewards and whenever the Quartermaster chooses the liberty campaign action.
Lose morale from: Penalties for mission failure or loss, from when you can‚Äôt pay Supply (-1) or Food (-2), or from whenever a soldier dies (-1).
If you lose morale and have none, soldiers desert (one per morale you can‚Äôt pay). You lose Rookies, then Soldiers. If fewer than 3 full squads, end the game. The Legion is no more.
BITD.SupplyLabel: A measure of the Legion‚Äôs spare gear, liquid funds, and trade goods.
BITD.SupplyDetail: Gain from mission rewards. Lose from mission penalties. If you lose supply and have none, lose 1 morale instead. Spend supply to boost campaign actions and to take additional campaign actions. You can keep a max of 3 Supply + 1 per Supply Cart for a total of
BITD.MaterielLabel: Supplies and items that make the Legion work
BITD.MaterielDetail: Spend 1 use of Food Stores when time passes or lose 2 morale. Carry up to 6 food per Food Stores with Supply Carts.
BITD.PersonnelLabel: Skilled personnel to keep the Legion operational
BITD.ActionsDetail: After missions, perform campaign actions based on morale (ask the Marshal). Take additional campaign actions by spending supply one-for-one. Spend a supply to boost an action in addition to any other costs. You can do each action once per campaign phase (except acquire assets and long-term projects).
BITD.Actions1Detail:
Beg, borrow, or steal an asset you need. Make a Fortune roll using the location‚Äôs assets rating. The result indicates the quality of the asset (1-3: Poor. 4/5: Standard. 6: Fine. crit: Exceptional). Laborers, Siege Weapons, and alchemical concoctions are fine quality. Alchemists and Mercies are exceptional quality.
Boosted: Upgrade result by one level. You may spend multiple supply.
BITD.Actions2Detail:
Legionnaires are given leave of their responsibilities for a few days, good food and drink is provided, and campfire revelry is permitted. During this time, Legionnaires at liberty can party, fraternize, or relax as they see fit. Every character clears up to 3 stress. Tell the Commander to increase Legion morale by 2.
Boosted: Legionnaires clear all stress. Tell the Commander to increase Legion morale by 4, instead of 2.
BITD.Actions3Detail:
Work on a long-term project, if you have the means. Pick a Specialist to lead the project. They roll an appropriate Action and mark segments on the project clock based on the result (1-3: One. 4/5: Two. 6: Three. crit: Five). You can do this campaign action multiple times, but only if working on a different project each time.
Boosted: Upgrade result by one level. You may spend multiple supply.
BITD.Actions4Detail:
The war has left soldiers crawling home and mercenaries guarding villages and roads (or raiding them). You recruit these recluses, rejects, and returning warriors to serve in the Legion‚Äôs ranks. Gain up to five Rookies for the Marshal to replenish the rosters with.
Boosted: Two of those Rookies are Soldiers instead (the other 3 remain Rookies).
BITD.Actions5Detail:
Take time to let soldiers tend wounds and rest. Each Legionnaire marks one tick in any harm row. Once a row‚Äôs healing ticks are full, erase the ticks and injuries in that row. If you wound a Mercy, one Specialist gains an extra healing tick. Finally, heal any Mercies who were wounded before this recuperation action.
Boosted: Every Legionnaire gains a second healing tick.
BITD.MerciesLabel: Unsettling healers who take wounds onto themselves
BITD.AlchemistsLabel: Scientists who can make alchemical brews and cure mystical diseases
BITD.AlchemistsHelp:
First, roll dice equal to Alchemists for effect.
Then roll Alchemists again for corruption (1-3: 3. 4/5: 2. 6: 1. crit: 0).
Distribute corruption among Alchemist clocks. When full, the Alchemist is blighted and ended.
Dangerous projects may add +1 or +2 corruption per roll.
BITD.AnnalsLabel: The collected history and deeds of the Legion
BITD.AnnalsDetail: When a soldier falls, note their name. When four are entered into the Annals, the next time that time passes, before campaign actions, take a moment to tell a tale and choose the effect it has on the Legion.
BITD.AnnalsLabel0: Tell a Tale of the Legion‚Äôs Founding
BITD.AnnalsDetail0:
Let me tell you a Tale of the Legion‚Äôs founding by the Seventh Emperor, as recorded 427 years ago in the first Annals...
  • Who was the first Commander / Legionnaire / Lorekeeper?
  • How (or for what) is that person remembered?
  • What dangerous threat was the Legion formed to face?
BITD.AnnalsEffect0:
• The soldiers learn a lesson. All Specialists may place 1 xp in any category.
  • The Legion seeks glory of yesteryear. Your next set of missions will include a special mission.
  • The histories raise morale. The Legion gains +2 morale.
BITD.AnnalsLabel1: Tell a Tale of the Legion‚Äôs Independence
BITD.AnnalsDetail1:
After the Old Empire fell, the Legion became sellswords that hired out to causes they believed in. This is a tale of...
  • Where is the Legion‚Äôs original charter stored?
  • What unusual restriction(s) are placed on Legionnaires?
  • What cause has the Legion taken up previously?
BITD.AnnalsEffect1:
• Legionnaires shrug off wounds. All Specialists may mark 1 free healing tick.
  • The Legion purifies hearts and minds. All Legionnaires reduce corruption by 2.
  • Soldiers work extra shifts. Add 3 ticks to a long-term project.
BITD.AnnalsLabel2: Tell a Tale of Hardening in Battle
BITD.AnnalsDetail2:
These undead are not the greatest threat the Legion has faced. Let me tell you a Tale of when we faced impossible odds...
  • What terrible power did this threat wield?
  • How was this threat‚Äôs unknown weakness found?
  • At what cost did the Legion overcome this foe?
BITD.AnnalsEffect2:
• The Legion digs in. Remove 1 pressure, but the Commander may not advance in the next phase.
  • Soldiers prepare to fight swiftly. Next mission, all Specialists gain +1d to maneuver rolls.
  • Soldiers prepare their strongest weapons. Next mission, all Specialists gain +1d to wreck rolls.
BITD.AnnalsLabel3: Tell a Tale of the Legion‚Äôs Unyielding Will
BITD.AnnalsDetail3:
We have fought holy and unholy since our inception, even in the Godswar, when Chosen took arms against Chosen...
  • Which previous Chosen did the Legion fight beside?
  • Against which supernatural threat did they fight?
  • How many survived and how did they rebuild the Legion?
BITD.AnnalsEffect3:
• Your Chosen is moved. Your Chosen gains 1 favor as if they had completed a favored mission.
  • Never give up. Next mission, all Legionnaires gain +1d to all resistance rolls.
  • Soldiers prepare to face the unholy. Next mission, all Legionnaires get +2d to resolve resists.
BITD.AnnalsLabel4: Tell a Tale of the Legion‚Äôs Meaning
BITD.AnnalsDetail4:
The Legion is no longer just a military, but family forged in blood over a century. This is a tale...
  • How do civilians treat the Legion differently from other units?
  • How are new recruits inducted into the Legion?
  • What oath must all Legionnaires speak?
BITD.AnnalsEffect4:
• The Legion promotes an exemplar. Promote a Rookie to Soldier.
  • Soldiers remember why they fight. One mission next session gains +2d to its engagement roll.
  • Legionnaires protect each other. Next primary mission, each Specialist gets 1 special armor: any.
BITD.AnnalsLabel5: Tell a Tale of Your Choice
BITD.AnnalsDetail5: When all Tales are told, and four more names enter your Annals, you may tell any Tale ‚Äî but each can only be told once until all types of Tales are told once again.
BITD.CampLabel: Scenes of life in the Legion
BITD.CampDetail: After missions are done but before campaign actions, play out a small scene about what happened at camp during or shortly after the mission. Remember to carry the story forward (e.g. soldier desertions and deaths still cause morale loss). Explore the struggles of life on the road while together with soldiers from many different cultures.
BITD.CampMorale1: Soldiers hold a remembrance for the fallen.
BITD.CampMorale2: A young soldier is detonating munitions, egged on by others.
BITD.CampMorale3: Storms darken the skies. Rumors and wild speculation spread.
BITD.CampMorale4: Supply crates go missing, but no one admits to knowing why.
BITD.CampMorale5: A squad talks about home and asks their captain about theirs.
BITD.CampMorale6: Your Chosen has fallen silent and refuses to speak to anyone.
BITD.CampMorale7: A fight breaks out over one Legionnaire stealing from another.
BITD.CampMorale8: After an undead attack, the Legion must break camp and relocate.
BITD.CampMorale9: A soldier is caught selling supplies to locals for special treats or favors.
BITD.CampMorale10: News arrives of devastation from a different front.
BITD.CampMorale11: A squad refuses to go into the field until their captain is replaced.
BITD.CampMorale12: A band of refugees stumbles upon your camp and begs for help.
BITD.CampMorale13: A festering blight wound covered up by a soldier is revealed.
BITD.CampMorale14: A bunch of Legion medical supplies are missing. The wounded cry.
BITD.CampMorale15: Hidden experimentation on an undead is uncovered within the camp.
BITD.CampMorale16: Screams can be heard in the distance at all hours, preventing any rest.
BITD.CampMorale17: A hungry squad that resorted to foraging becomes badly ill.
BITD.CampMorale18: A deserter is caught before they can leave. Judgment must be passed.
BITD.MissionHelp: Roll 1d for Trained spies (Add 1d for Masters). Advance the mission clock according to the following results. 1-3: 1 tick and the spy is Wounded. 4/5: 2 ticks. 6: 3 ticks. Crit: 5 ticks.
BITD.SMissionsDetail:
During campaign actions, you can assign spies to simple assignments. Spies on simple assignment cannot undertake long-term assignments.
  • Recover: The spy heals and recuperates. Remove their wounded condition.
  • Interrogate Ask the Commander for the intel questions list. Your spy is sent on a mission and can answer one question from any list (regardless of the Commander‚Äôs intel total) whenever missions are presented by the GM.
  • Blackmail: Spy bribes or threatens as needed. Add +1d to an acquire assets roll.
  • Help: Spy bribes or threatens as needed. Add +1d to a long-term project roll.
BITD.LTMissionsDetail: During campaign actions, spies may be given long-term assignments. Only 1 spy may be sent on each assignment. A wounded spy that is wounded again dies. Click the Mission labels to roll for each Mission.
BITD.AugmentDetail:
Use contacts to bolster the Commander‚Äôs mission selection.

Complete: Next GM mission generation, tell them to add +1 to the rewards and mission penalty rolls on one mission of the Commander‚Äôs focus type. That type must appear once.
BITD.ExpandDetail:
Take the time to build contacts, informants, and local resources in the area, and expand and hone your spies‚Äô effectiveness.

Complete: Choose a new spy network advancement connected to any piece of the network you have.
BITD.TrapDetail:
Goad an undead with a known weakness or desire into exposing themselves to attack.

Complete: The next mission list will include an assault mission to attack a specific Lieutenant or Infamous.
BITD.RecruitDetail:
Spies lead dangerous lives. Sometimes you have to recruit more.

Complete: If you‚Äôve lost a spy, add one to the roster. You can only have 2 spies at a time, or 3 if you have Acquisition in your spy network.
BITD.ResearchDetail:
Undercover spies research an area for high-reward missions.

Complete: Learn all the special missions in a location, and if the Commander spends an intel to acquire one, you may pick which to do. If you move past the location, reset the clock.
BITD.SpiesLabel: The covert operatives who aid the Legion
BITD.CommanderDuties:
• Track Time and Pressure. Pressure and time increase when time passes or for certain mission penalties. Pressure decreases from some missions, and advancing resets it to zero. Time (rarely) decreases as a result of select missions.
  • Track Location and Movement. Decide when the Legion advances. You may never backtrack. Mark the Legion position and route on your map. When you advance, roll pressure minus Horses uses spent, and add time based on the roll. (1-3: One. 4/5: Two. 6: Three. crit: Five.)
  • Track and Spend Intel. Spend intel to add +1d to mission engagement rolls or gain access to a special mission at your location. Ask intel questions before each mission. Intel can be gained from mission rewards.
  • Pick Missions. Decide on a type of mission to focus on (assault, recon, religious, or supply) and tell the GM. The GM will tell you what‚Äôs available. Pick two missions to perform and designate one ‚Äúprimary,‚Äù to be played out at the table. The other is secondary and resolved with an engagement roll. If you were presented with a third mission, you automatically fail it.
  • Work with Other Roles. Consult with the rest of the players to make the best decisions you can, but you have the final say in the duties you are tasked with. The fate of the Legion is in your hands. Good luck.
BITD.MarshalDuties:
• Track Morale. Morale increases during the liberty campaign action, and from mission rewards. It decreases from mission penalties, when soldiers die (-1 per), and when there isn‚Äôt supply (-1) or Food (-2) when it must be spent.
  • Assign Who Goes On And Leads Missions. Decide who goes on missions. Missions take 1 squad and up to 2 Specialists by default. If there‚Äôs an Officer on a mission, they‚Äôre in charge. Otherwise, you say who‚Äôs in charge.
  • Track squads and Specialists. Between missions, keep the playbooks. Mark losses, harm, stress, advancement, and promotions. Name squad members as needed. Detail any Specialists the Legion gains.
  • Make Engagement Rolls. See the back of this sheet. It‚Äôs your duty to roll.
  • Ensure Legionnaires Advance. Make sure the group remembers to track xp after missions. Secondary missions grant 2 xp to Specialists regardless of outcome.
  • Work with Other Roles. Consult with others to make the best decisions you can, but you have the final say in the duties you are tasked with.
BITD.QuartermasterDuties:
• Track and Spend Supply. You gain supply primarily from supply mission rewards. Spend supply for additional campaign actions or to boost a campaign action. When the Commander advances the Legion, lose any supply you can‚Äôt take with you (maximum 3 supply, plus 1 per Supply Cart).
  • Track and Use Materiel and Non-Legion Personnel. Expend materiel to make missions more successful. Track Mercy and Alchemist statuses, such as wounds and corruption. Work on projects to change the position of the Legion.
  • Perform Campaign Actions. Between mission phases, perform a number of campaign actions according to troop morale. Ask the Marshal how many you get.
  • Work with Other Roles. Consult with the rest of the players to make the best decisions you can, but you have the final say in the duties you are tasked with. The fate of the Legion is in your hands. Good luck.
BITD.LorekeeperDuties:
• Track the Dead. Note every Legionnaire that dies. The book weighs heavy, but while there is still a Legion, you have a sacred duty to remember all sacrifices.
  • Tell the Tales of the Legion. When four new names are added to your lists of the dead, tell a Tale of the Legion. Answer all questions the Tale asks in your story, then choose one benefit to the troops. The first five tales in that order.
  • Keep the Annals. Note missions, who is sent, and their outcomes. If there is any question what happened, it is your duty to recall it for others. Keep these books safe. If you‚Äôve kept the Annals faithfully through the end of the campaign, and they‚Äôve reached Skydagger Keep safely, add 10 points to your final score.
  • Set Back at Camp Scenes. Consult with the Marshal on morale before making your selection. If a decision needs to be made about the camp or its rules, you will make them.
  • Work with Other Roles. Advise the other Roles as necessary. Keep in mind the Legion‚Äôs beliefs and lessons you have set, and remind them.
BITD.SpymasterDuties:
• Dispatch Spies. Dispatch spies on assignments during campaign actions. Simple assignments complete immediately (though interrogation takes place right before missions). Long-term assignments take time to finish, and different spies may take turns working on them.
  • Grow Your Network. Your true enemies are the Broken. Prepare for them.
  • Work with Other Roles. Consult with the other Roles to make the best decisions you can, but you have the final say in the duties you are tasked with. The fate of the Legion is in your hands. Good luck.
BITD.TraumaColdTip: You're unmoved by emotional appeals or social bonds
BITD.TraumaHauntedTip: You're often lost in reverie, reliving past horrors or seeing things others may not see
BITD.TraumaObsessedTip: You're enthralled by one thing: an activity, a person, a goal, an ideology
BITD.TraumaParanoidTip: You imagine danger everywhere and can't trust others
BITD.TraumaRecklessTip: You have little regard for your own safety, best interests, or well-being
BITD.TraumaSoftTip: You lose your edge, becoming sentimental, passive, or gentle
BITD.TraumaUnstableTip: Your emotional state is volatile.  You can instantly rage, fall into despair, act impulsively, or freeze up
BITD.TraumaViciousTip: You seek out opportunities to hurt people, even for no good reason
BITD.BlightAnathemaTip: Sources of divine power burn you
BITD.BlightHostTip: Something has infested your body and is slowly taking over
BITD.BlightHungerTip: You have an unnatural desire to feed on human flesh and blood
BITD.BlightMiasmaTip: You generate an aura or cloud of sickness and decay
BITD.BlightMutatedTip: Your body warps, growing new features or changing old ones
BITD.BlightRageTip: An ever-present need to destroy fills your mind
BITD.BlightRotTip: Your body begins to rot and die
BITD.BlightVisionsTip: Hallucinations and terrors fill your hours, waking and sleeping
BITD.ClassExpClue1: Every time you roll a desperate action, mark xp in that action's attribute.
BITD.ClassExpClue2: You expressed your beliefs, drives, heritage, or background.
BITD.ClassExpClue3: You struggled with issues from your vice or traumas during the session.
BITD.ClassExpClueDescription: At the end of each session, for each item below, mark 1 xp (in your playbook or an attribute) or 2 xp if that item occurred multiple times.
BITD.AddUpgrades: Default upgrades/gear to add to sheet during creation
BITD.RollTokenDescription: Add +1d for each Trait rating and +1d for each Major Advantage, -1d for each Major Disadvantage.
BITD.RollPartialSuccessPositionControlle: You hesitate. Withdraw and try a different approach, or else do it with a minor consequence: a minor complication occurs, you have reduced effect, you suffer lesser harm, you end up in a risky position.
BITD.RollPartialSuccessPositionRisky: You do it, but there‚Äôs a consequence: you suffer harm, a complication occurs, you have reduced effect, you end up in a desperate position.
BITD.RollPartialSuccessPosition: You do it, but there‚Äôs a consequence: you suffer severe harm, a serious complication occurs, you have reduced effect.
BITD.RollFailurePositionControlled: You falter. Press on by seizing a risky opportunity, or withdraw and try a different approach.
BITD.RollFailurePositionRisky: Things go badly. You suffer harm, a complication occurs, you end up in a desperate position, you lose this opportunity.
BITD.RollFailurePositionDesperate: It‚Äôs the worst outcome. You suffer severe harm, a serious complication occurs, you lose this opportunity for action.
BITD.RollGreatEffectDescription:
You get an exceptional result or an extreme effect.

If this is an engagement roll, you've already overcome the first obstacle and are in a controlled position for whatever is next.

If you're marking faction or healing clocks, mark 5 segments.
BITD.RollStandardEffectDescription:
You get a good result or full effect.

If this is an engagement roll, you start in a controlled position.

If you're marking faction or healing clocks, mark 3 segments.
BITD.RollLimitedEffectDescription:
You get a mixed result or a partial effect.

If this is an engagement roll, you start in a risky position.

If you're marking faction or healing clocks, mark 2 segments.
BITD.RollPoorEffectDescription:
You get a bad result or little effect.

If this is an engagement roll, you start in a desperate position.
Good luck!

If you're marking faction or healing clocks, mark 1 segment.
BITD.RollResistDescription:
You reduce or completely avoid the effects of the consequences (GM choice).

Take Stress equal to 6 minus the highest (or lowest in case of a 0d roll) die result, which should be
BITD.RollCritResistDescription:
You reduce or completely avoid the effects of the consequences (GM choice).

Clear 1 Stress.
BITD.RollVerySlowDescription: The Legion advances very slowly and a great deal of time passes before you arrive. Add five ticks to the Time clocks.
BITD.RollSlowDescription: The Legion advances slowly and a lot of time passes before you arrive. Add three ticks to the Time clocks.
BITD.RollModerateDescription: The Legion advances at a moderate pace and some time passes before you arrive. Add two ticks to the Time clocks.
BITD.RollFastDescription: The Legion advances quickly and little time passes before you arrive. Add one tick to the Time clocks.
BITD.RollEngFailDescription:
Primary Mission: You‚Äôre in a desperate position when the action starts.
Secondary Mission: You fail the mission, lose 3 squad members, and all Specialists take level 3 harm.
BITD.RollEngPartialDescription:
Primary Mission: You are in a risky position when the action starts.
Secondary Mission: Fail the mission OR you can succeed, but two squad members die and all Specialists take level 2 harm.
BITD.RollEngSuccessDescription:
Primary Mission: You‚Äôre in a controlled position when the action starts.
Secondary Mission: You succeed at the mission, all Specialists take level 1 harm, and you may choose to lose 2 squad members to promote a Rookie to Soldier.
BITD.RollEngCritDescription: Primary Mission: You‚Äôve overcome the first obstacle and are in a controlled position at the next.
BITD.RollAlcFailDescription:
Alchemical Effect: You get a bad result or little effect. Roll again for corruption.
Corruption: Distribute 3 corruption among your Alchemists.
BITD.RollAlcPartialDescription:
Alchemical Effect: You get a mixed result or a partial effect. Roll again for corruption.
Corruption: Distribute 2 corruption among your Alchemists.
BITD.RollAlcSuccessDescription:
Alchemical Effect: You get a good result or full effect. Roll again for corruption.
Corruption: Distribute 1 corruption among your Alchemists.
BITD.RollAlcCritDescription:
Alchemical Effect: You get an exceptional result or an extreme effect. Roll again for corruption.
Corruption: Distribute 0 corruption among your Alchemists.
BITD.RollMisFailDescription: Add 1 tick to the Mission clock and the spy sent on this mission becomes Wounded
BITD.RollMisPartialDescription: Add 2 ticks to the Mission clock.
BITD.RollMisSuccessDescription: Add 3 ticks to the Mission clock.
BITD.RollMisCritDescription: Add 5 ticks to the Mission clock!
BITD.RollZeromode: Zero Dice rolled - rolling two dice and taking the lowest
BITD.SkillsInsightTip: Use Insight to avoid or reduce a consequence from deception or understanding.
BITD.SkillsResearchTip: When you Research, you scrutinize details and interpret evidence.
BITD.SkillsRigTip: When you Rig, you alter how an existing mechanism works or create a new one.
BITD.SkillsScoutTip: When you Scout, you move or observe without being noticed.
BITD.SkillsProwessTip: Use Insight to avoid or reduce a consequence from physical strain or injury.
BITD.SkillsManeuverTip: When you Maneuver, you lift, climb, jump, run, or swim, either away from or towards danger.
BITD.SkillsShootTip: When you Shoot, you fire at a target with precision from a distance.
BITD.SkillsSkirmishTip: When you Skirmish, you engage in close combat with a hostile opponent.
BITD.SkillsWreckTip: When you Wreck, you apply savage force or careful sabotage to destroy a place, item, or obstacle.
BITD.SkillsResolveTip: Use Insight to avoid or reduce a consequence from mental strain or willpower or to reduce the effects of Corruption.
BITD.SkillsConsortTip: When you Consort, you socialize with friends and contacts.
BITD.SkillsDisciplineTip: When you Discipline, you compel obedience with your force of personality.
BITD.SkillsMarshalTip: When you Marshal, you direct a squad or group of people to action.
BITD.SkillsSwayTip: When you Sway, you influence someone with guile, charm, or logic.
BITD.SkillsSpecialistTip: Specialist actions are not rolled and are specific to your class.  You have a number of uses per action equal to its rating.
BITD.SkillsAnchorTip: When you Anchor, you use your size and training to clash with more numerous or superior foes.  Each use allows you to fight as a small group.
BITD.SkillsAimTip: When you Aim, you use careful timing and cool nerves to improve your shot.  Each use increases the effect level of your shot.
BITD.SkillsChannelsTip: When you use Channels, you leverage connections, social capital, and authority to acquire additional supplies.  Each use acquires an asset in a flashback.  Make a Sway roll to determine quality.
BITD.SkillsDoctorTip: When you Doctor, you use specialized medical training to soothe and treat wounds.  Each use allows one person to ignore harm penalties for one scene.
BITD.SkillsGritTip: When you use Grit, you use the hard lessons taught to you over the course of your career to endure.  Each use reduces the stress cost of a resistance roll, one time per roll.
BITD.SkillsScroungeTip: When you Scrounge, you repurpose the environment around you to find shelter or useful items.  Each use gets you shelter for an evening or one load of supplies for the squad.
BITD.SkillsWeaveTip: When you Weave, you invoke arcane powers to change the world around you at great risk.  Each use can also allow you to identify an artifact or sense the divine.
BITD.EffectWarning: Managing Active Effects within an Owned Item is not currently supported by FoundryVTT and will be added in a subsequent update.
BITD.ClassWarning:
Please note that changing class will delete all Loadout items and changing to Rookie class will reset your character's skills entirely.

Cancel if you do not wish to continue.
BITD.ActionsHelp:
Roll 1d per action rating.
Improve your chances using the following:
Get An Assist: Get +1d if another PC assisted you, then that PC takes 1 stress
Push Yourself: Take 2 stress for: +1d, +1 to effect, or to take action when you're incapacitated, but you can't take a Devil's Bargain
Devil's Bargain: Accept a consequence to get +1d, but you can't Push Yourself
Group Action: All involved PCs make an action roll and count the single best result, but the leader takes 1 stress for each failure
Setup Action: If this action roll succeeds and it makes sense in the fiction, give improved position or +1 effect to the next PC's action roll
BITD.ResistanceHelp:
Roll 1d for each action with at least one action rating for the relevant attribute to reduce or completely avoid (GM's choice) the effects of consequences.
Take 6 minus the highest die result as stress
Insight: consequences from deception or understanding
Prowess: consequences from physical strain or injury
Resolve: consequences from mental strain/willpower/Corruption
